diff_hunk:
@@ -563,6 +563,37 @@ def batch_norm(input, running_mean, running_var, weight=None, bias=None,
     return f(input, weight, bias)
 
 
+def relation(input, g, f=None, embedding=None, max_pairwise=None):
+    # Batch size, number of objects, feature size
+    b, o, c = input.size()
+    # Construct pairwise indices
+    i = Variable(torch.arange(0, o).long().repeat(o))
+    j = Variable(torch.arange(0, o).long().repeat(o, 1).t().contiguous().view(-1))
body: Indexing requires longs (integers) - even if the underlying floats are supposedly ints. Just removed the `.long()` casts to check and yes indeed they are necessary.
